title: Latin America & the Caribbean : homicide rates 2017 , by country
summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in the y axis.
The Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is highest at Country El Salvador and lowest at Country Chile.
There is a difference of 57.5 between the maximum Country El Salvador and minimum Country Chile.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in the y axis.
The Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is highest at Country El Salvador and lowest at Country Chile.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in the y axis.
The Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is highest at Country El Salvador and lowest at Country Chile.
There is a difference of 57.5 between the maximum Country El Salvador and minimum Country Chile.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants for 22 number of Countrys.
Country El Salvador has the highest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants and Chile has the lowest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants.
Second maximum Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is found at Country Jamaica.
There is a difference of 57.5 between the maximum Country El Salvador and minimum Country Chile.
Country El Salvador is higher than any other Countrys with value 61.8, followed by Jamaica, and Honduras. Down to Country Chile with the lowest value 4.3.
The Country El Salvador has 2.97 times more Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants than average.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 457.4.
